title: Tense working climate, suspicions of tax evasion: Disney France caught in a storm
summary: A new redundancy plan at Disney France, a subsidiary of the entertainment giant, is causing confusion and unease among employees.

title: The gradual erosion of British trade since Brexit
summary: The UK's trade in goods has fallen by 10% since 2019, while that of the other G7 countries has risen by 5%.

title: Former Trump adviser recounts fear over 'Access Hollywood' tape during presidential campaign
summary: Hope Hicks was a key player in the final stages of Trump's successful 2016 presidential campaign when hush money payments to porn star Stormy Daniels were allegedly made.

title: EU-Lebanon deal aims to prevent Syrian refugees from reaching Cyprus
summary: The European Union plans to allocate €1 billion in aid to Beirut in exchange for cooperation from the Lebanese authorities in curbing illegal immigration to Europe.

title: Solène Brun, sociologist: 'The myth of happy mixed-race completely conceals relations of power and domination'
summary: In her latest study, the sociologist shows that mixed-race is first and foremost a social experience and analyzes how race is constructed within mixed-race families.

title: Discovering Vienna in Freud's footsteps
summary: The famous neurologist and founder of psychoanalysis lived in the Austrian capital for half a century.

title: Hamas sending delegation to Egypt for truce talks
summary: Foreign mediators have been waiting for a Hamas response to a proposal to halt the fighting for 40 days and exchange hostages for Palestinian prisoners.

title: How Macron wants to 'Europeanize' nuclear deterrence
summary: The French president is looking to extend France's nuclear deterrent capability in light of Donald Tump's possible return to the White House and the ongoing war in Ukraine, experts say.

title: Canada: Three arrested over killing of Sikh activist
summary: Canadian broadcaster CBC said Friday, May 3, that the suspects are facing first-degree murder and conspiracy charges.

title: Xi Jinping in Paris: 'It's a slap from Macron,' say France's Uyghurs
summary: While several Western countries, including the United States, France and the United Kingdom, have denounced an ongoing 'genocide' against the Uyghurs, the Chinese president is due to land to make a state visit to Paris on Monday and Tuesday.

title: France condemns deadly attack on Red Cross convoy in Sudan
summary: The ICRC said gunmen killed two drivers and injured three staff in South Darfur last Thursday as they returned from a humanitarian mission.

title: The false and obscene Spanish story of the Ravensbrück brothel
summary: In a bestseller she claims is based on historical fact, writer Fermina Cañaveras wrongly depicts a Spanish deportee who was supposedly forced into prostitution.

title: European elections: Macron pick Hayer fails to unnerve far-right Bardella in debate
summary: The ruling coalition's figurehead for the European elections failed to destabilize her far-right counterpart who lambasted President Emmanuel Macron's record during an encounter that often dwelt on non-European topics.

title: Why French music exports are still going strong
summary: The phenomenon of synchronization and the popularity of music sung in French explain the success of French musical productions abroad, according to a study.

title: Drugs in Paris: The leak that implicated a police chief
summary: Overdose. France under the influence | Part 4. Le Monde learned that a highly experienced chief brigadier, who for a long time was in charge of narcotics in the Paris suburbs, is suspected of having colluded with major drug traffickers.

title: Moulin Rouge loses blades, not glory
summary: The cabaret's red blades fell onto the Pigalle sidewalk on April 25. But this landmark of Parisian nightlife has witnessed plenty of drama in its 135-year history.

title: Channel Islands dream of tunnel linking them to France
summary: Economic and political leaders in the Channel Islands are seriously considering building a tunnel to connect Jersey and Guernsey with the French coast. Locally, the not-so-new idea is no longer met with mockery.

title: German foreign minister summons Russia over 2023 cyber-attacks
summary: Annalena Baerbock said on Friday that Russian state hackers were behind the hacking of emails of the Social Democrats, the leading party in the governing coalition.

title: Noose is tightening around Ukrainian exiles of fighting age
summary: Kyiv has ordered the temporary suspension of all consular activities for men aged between 18 and 60. In Berlin, Paris and Warsaw, there is both concern and anger.

title: Belgium's ports drowning under glut of Chinese electric cars: 'Some are parked here for a year, sometimes a year and a half'
summary: Due to China's overcapacity in production – as it aims to capture a quarter of the European electric vehicle market – the ports of Antwerp and Zeebrugge are inundated.

title: Kenya hit by 'one of the most violent' El Niño episodes since 1950
summary: At least 29 of the country's 47 counties are affected by heavy rains. Kenya's death toll from flooding has risen to at least 188 since March.
